title: Optics & Berkeley Extension Calculator
text:
This website hosts interactive optics and programming calculators that run entirely in your browser using Pyodide (Python in WebAssembly).





A comprehensive collection of 143 programs converted from MATLAB and C to Python:

138 MATLAB Programs covering:

Geometrical Optics
Interference
Diffraction
Coherence
Matrix Methods
Fourier Transform
Wavefront Analysis
Aberrations
And moreâ€¦

5 Berkeley Extension C Programs:

Sales Tax Calculator
Seconds to Time Converter
Trip Time Calculator
Print Odd Numbers
Displaying Consecutive Numbers


All programs run in the browser using React + Vite + Pyodide with interactive plots generated by Matplotlib.








âš›ï¸ React + Vite

10+ physics formulas
Auto-connected pipeline
Modern component architecture




ğŸ Pyodide Integration

Run Python in browser
Code editor
Sequential execution




ğŸ›ï¸ Signal Processing

Zero-pole analysis
SymPy computation
Interactive plots








React 18 - Modern UI framework
Vite 5 - Fast build tool
Pyodide - Python runtime (WebAssembly)
NumPy - Numerical computing
Matplotlib - Data visualization
Quarto - Static site generator






Browse Programs: Click on any program category to see available programs
Run Programs: Click on a program card to open its interactive page
Adjust Parameters: Many programs support parameter adjustment
View Results: See both plots and text output

Symbolic mathematics with equation manipulation and variable swapping.


ğŸ”€ Variable Swapping Demo
Features: - Symbolic Equation Rearrangement: Automatically rearrange equations using SymPy - Variable Swapping: Solve for any variable in the same block (e.g., d=s/t â†’ s=d*t â†’ t=s/d) - Unknown Variables: Display equations with symbolic variables before substitution - Pyodide Cache Status: Visual indicator showing if Pyodide is loaded from cache - LaTeX Rendering: Beautiful equation display with MathJax
Example Equation: d = s / t (distance = speed / time) - Solve for d (distance): Input s, t â†’ Calculate d - Solve for s (speed): Input d, t â†’ Calculate s - Solve for t (time): Input d, s â†’ Calculate t
All in the same interactive block!
